task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 189°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will tilt my view upwards to see the roof.
My heading was reset after looking up, so I need to turn back to face the building at 189° South to continue my assessment.
I have reoriented myself to face the building; now I will look up again to see the top and estimate its height.
The system seems to reset my heading to 0° when I only adjust the pitch; I will try to set both the heading and pitch in a single rotation command to correctly view the top of the building.
I can see the upper floors but not the absolute top of the building, so I need to tilt my view further up to see the roofline.
The system keeps resetting my heading when I adjust the pitch; I will set both the heading and a higher pitch angle simultaneously to see the top of the building.
I have observed the building from ground to roof; it appears to have approximately 6 floors, and assuming 3.5 meters per floor plus a roof structure, I estimate the height to be around 22 meters.
